content: stitches but don t pull them closed until you ve added one last little bit of stuffing with the tweezers at this point you might like to check the side seams for signs of the stuffing showing through the easiest way to deal with ladders like these is to darn over those little lines to double them just thread your yarn back and forth along the stretched part you don t need to pull it tight you may or may not be able to see how much better that side seam looks after a bit of darning now to add the little bits that turn a pear shaped piece of knitting into a gnome i found it easier to knit these on straight needles the beard cast on one stitch row 1 kf&b 2 sts row 2 kf&b k1 3 sts row 3 kf&b pso k2 row 4 kf&b pso p1 k1 6 row 5 kf&b k2 4sts row 6 kf&b p2 k1 5 sts row 7 kf&b pso k4 row 8 kf&b pso p1 k1 twice row 9 kf&b k4 6 sts row 10 kf&b p4 k1 7 sts row 11 kf&b pso k6 row 12 kf&b pso p1 k1 x 3 row 13 kf&b k6 8 sts row 14 kf&b p6 k1 9 sts row 15 kf&b pso k8 row 16 kf&b pso p1 k1 x 4 row 17 kf&b k8 10 sts row 18 kf&b p8 k1 11 sts cast off knitwise leaving a long tail pin the beard to the front of the gnome lining up the cast off edge with the bottom of the hat the side of the knitting that is mostly smooth is the right side sew the beard to the body along the top edge and then down one side of the beard and up the other if you make your stitches between the bumps on the sides they will keep their uneven edges the nose using the long tail method cast on three stitches row 1 and every odd numbered row purl row 2 k1 m1 k1 twice 5 sts row 4 k1 m1 k3 m1 k1 7 sts row 6 k1 m1 k5 m1 k1 9 sts row 8 knit row 9 purl row 10 ssk k to last 2 sts k2tog 7 repeat row 9 and 10 until you have three stitches on your needle again and then cast off purlwise leaving a long tail darn in the cast on tail and then use the long tail to sew a line of short running stitches round the edge of the knitting and gather it into a circle if you then gather the new edge of the shape it will tighten the circle a bit more and tidy it up position the nose in the middle of the gnome s front so that about a third of it is above the top of the beard and two thirds below sew the nose firmly
